results.title: Cry freedom
results.creator_credit: Marble Arch Productions, Universal Pictures and Richard Attenborough
results.brief_description: The unforgettable friendship of two unforgettable men. The tension and the terror of South Africa is powerfully portrayed in director Richard Attenborough’s sweeping story of black activist Stephen Biko (Denzel Washington) and liberal white newspaper editor Donald Woods (Kevin Kline) who risks his life to bring Biko’s story to the world. In this explosive, emotional and thrilling film, Woods slowly learns the true horrors of apartheid through Biko’s eyes. When the South African authorities begin to view Biko as a major threat to their government, he is arrested and silenced by the police. Determined not to let Biko’s message go unheard, Woods, himself now under house arrest, undertakes a perilous quest to escape South Africa. This riveting true adventure offers a stirring account of man at his most evil and most heroic.

results.title: Cry for help
results.creator_credit: Oxford Films (U.S.) and A. Scott Miller
results.brief_description: A young boy falls into his family’s swimming pool. When he is discovered the emergency service is called and saves the boy with the help of a local hospital. Then the narration describes the essential elements of a successful community emergency service including a common emergency phone number, well equipped ambulances and communication between ambulances and hospitals.

results.title: Cry-baby = Cry baby
results.creator_credit: Rachel Talalay, Imagine Entertainment (US), Universal Pictures and John Waters
results.brief_description: Johnny Depp is Wade “Cry-baby” Walker, a cool, tough but sensitive teenage delinquent. His ability to shed a single tear drives the girls wild. Cry-baby and his friends live on the outer edges of “normal society”. Their “badness” attracts the beautiful rich but square Allison and she is drawn into their rockabilly, fast car world. The soundtrack is excellent, and the rock ‘n roll era of the 1950’s is vividly recreated. Johnny Depp is appealing as Cry-baby and is well supported by co-stars Amy Locane, Susan Tyrell, Iggy Pop, Ricky Lake, Traci Lords and Polly Bergen. John Waters style is firmly stamped on this film as he recreates a nostalgia for an era.

results.title: CRWDSPCR
results.creator_credit: Elliot Caplan and Cunningham Dance Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Merce Cunningham Dance Company = Cunningham Dance Foundation”.
CRWDSPCR features the choreographic process of Merce Cunningham’s work with the computer program “LifeForms”. Cunningham, an inveterate explorer of new technology, became interested in “how the computer opens the eye to detail — the way a photograph does.” Shot over the course of one year, CRWDSPCR follows the dancers from Cunningham’s dance company as they transform his computerized images to staged reality. Music by John King. Reference: http://www.merce.org/filmvideo.html

results.title: Crustaceans: lobsters, barnacles, shrimps and their relative
results.creator_credit: William A. Anderson and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The appearances, habitat and behaviour of the most important types of Crustaceans are shown. The distinguishing features of the five tuypes are illustrated with close-up views of the animals in their natural environment. Designed for high school classes in biology and zoology.

results.title: Crustacea from the gulf of Maine
results.brief_description: Balanus, Caprella, Crago, Hippolyte, Homarus, and Pagarus serve to illustrate various groups pf crustaceans found along the rocky coast of Maine. The picture opens with a colony of barnacles in action, followed by high magnifications of the cirri. Several specimens shed their integuments to allow for continual growth. Large individuals dredged from deep water are similarly shown. The skeleton shrimp shows its protective blending of form and colour with the algal background, and we see the peculiar structure of this obscure animal. The prawn and lobster reveal decapod structure and activity and demonstrate such features as the main divisions of the body, the mouth parts and the sensory and ecomotor appendages. The hermit crabs protect themselves by occupying the shells of various gastropod molluscs, and one individual deprived of its shell is seem to enter a new one in time to avoid capture of another hermit crab.

results.title: Crushed
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A young man, in his disgust at watching a terrible film entitled “Fear”, makes the dramatic decision to run it over several times with his car.

results.title: Crush
results.creator_credit: Bridget Ikin, Hibiscus Films and Alison MacLean
results.brief_description: Alison Maclean’s (“Kitchen sink”, “Jesus’ son”) debut feature is a macabre psychological study of obsession, sexual jealousy and female friendships. Marcia Gay Harden stars as the brazen and destructive Lane, a classic femme fatale archetype who finds herself stuck in the sleepy New Zealand town of Rotorua after she and her girlfriend Christina (Donogh Rees) are involved in a near fatal car accident. Lane walks away from the crash site unharmed, leaving her friend for dead and lands on the doorstep of the shy and tomboyish Angela (Caitlin Bossley) and her novelist father Colin (William Zappa). The awkward teen soon develops a crush on the more sexually confident Lane, who in turn makes a play for Angela’s father, leaving the abandoned girl devastated and thirsty for revenge. Maclean uses the shifting power plays as an astute metaphor for New Zealand’s own confused relationship to cultural identity, shrewdly casting an American as the self assured and opportunistic outsider, while setting the film in the mainly Maori community of Rotorua. Cast also includes Peter Smith and Jon Brazier.

results.title: Crusades: 1095-1291
results.brief_description: Discusses the social, economic and religious climate that gave birth and then momentum to the Crusades and treats the various Crusades from a human viewpoint.
